definition[0]: someone who is mute does not speak, or refuses to speak
example[0]: Billy continued to stand there, mute and defiant.
definition[1]: someone who is mute is unable to speak
definition[2]: to make the sound of something quieter, or make it disappear completely
example[1]: Excess noise can be reduced by muting alarms and telephones.
definition[3]: to make a musical instrument sound softer
definition[4]: to reduce the level of criticism, protest, discussion etc that is happening
example[2]: The incident so shocked all the students that it muted further protest.
definition[5]: a small piece of metal, rubber etc that you place over or into a musical instrument to make it sound softer
